Rat Trap grins at Perceptor's words.

"When in doubt pull out the old bug b=
oms'n poison them half ta death. They gotta have a weakness, everyone does.=
  Well, why not find it'n use it against 'em?"

Tucson turns to Rat Trap.

=
" A weakness...   We've yet to find out what that is don't we?  I agree wit=
h Rat Trap, a weakness has got to be researched and considered if we're goi=
ng to immobilize those insectoids."

He then turns his head in the directio=
n of Talon.

"I agree with you about Nightlight, please, see what you can d=
o to help her, the sooner she's back with us, the better. Rodimus should ne=
ver be without one of the most valuable things in his life, those he loves =
and those he cherrishes."

Night Shift paces back and forth.

" What if by =
chance I snuck back in ta that fortress'n hacked inta their data files'n pu=
lled up that shell program file of theirs'n sent it back here ta you guys..=
.   Could we actually reverse the effects of that simply by reading the dat=
a on that file?"

Rat Trap looks to him curiously.

"Heeeey, that could wor=
k.  But that's up ta Wheels if he wants you ta try that."

Tucson turns his=
 head in Night Shift's direction.

"As interesting as that sounds, I don't =
think it would be wise for you to do something this complicated by yourself=
. Too many Autobots fell to the wrath of the Decepticons and I'd hate to lo=
se another to Hydras."

Night Shift nodds.

"Yes sir, Tucson Prime.  I won'=
t try it alone, I promise."

Tucson turns his head to everyone.

" Night Sh=
ift, your course of action is well coordinated and I believe that route sho=
uld be tried.  But as I've said before, you aren't doing this alone.  Would=
 anyone like to volunteer for the recon mission?"
